pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:0.5_0: The training rule on beds and benches
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.10_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.11.1_0: ‘If a monk is having a new bed or bench made, it is to have legs eight standard fingerbreadths long below the lowest frame.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.11.1_1: If one uses them beyond that, one commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.2_0: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan was sleeping on a high bed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.3_0: On one occasion, as the Buddha and a number of monks were walking about the dwellings, they came to Upananda’s dwelling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.6_0: “Sir, please come and see my bed.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.7_0: The Buddha turned around on the spot and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.8_0: “A fool, monks, can be recognized by his sleeping place.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.9_0: After criticizing Upananda in many ways for being difficult to support ... the Buddha said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.11_0: If he makes one, or has one made, that exceeds that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct. When he obtains it, the legs are to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.12.1_0: If she finishes what she began herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.13_0: If she has others finish what she began herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.14_0: If she finishes herself what was begun by others, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.15_0: If she has others finish what was begun by others, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.16_0: If she makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.17_0: If she obtains one that was made by someone else and then uses it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.4_0: there are four kinds of beds: legs and frame with detachable legs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.6_0: there are four kinds of benches: legs, legs, frame, called _masāraka_; one with detachable legs; one with detachable legs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.8_0: is building or is having built.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.9_0: It is to have legs eight standard fingerbreadths long below the lowest frame:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.2_0: if she makes it the right size;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.3_0: if she makes it less than the right size;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.4_0: if she obtains one made by someone else that exceeds the right size and she cuts it down before using it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.7_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on beds and benches, is finished.
